tips.tip: Try gens without a prompt at all for unexpected results
tips.context: For more creative and abstract transitions

tips.tip: Match pose resolution carefully - sometimes you want thicker skeletons
tips.context: When using DWPose with different video resolutions

tips.tip: Add pure silence for b-roll shots to prevent blabbering
tips.context: When creating music videos with instrumental sections

tips.tip: Use Google AI Studio to create better studio-style headshots and full body shots
tips.context: For improving reference image quality before generation

tips.tip: Use 'first to last frame' or control video inputs for lots of motion
tips.context: When you want specific motion that you're looking for

tips.tip: Describe background in every prompt for better backgrounds
tips.context: When backgrounds look too basic or simple

tips.tip: Add 'rapping' to HuMo prompts for more realism
tips.context: When creating rap or music videos

tips.tip: Describing the position helps with OpenPose
tips.context: When OpenPose isn't picking up smaller figures in frame

tips.tip: Try bumping shift value on low noise sampler up for artifacts
tips.context: When getting square artifacts in video output

tips.tip: Use dimensions 1024x576 for best results
tips.context: Standard resolution that works well across workflows

tips.tip: For prompts that need to indicate silence, use 'standing silently' vs just 'standing'
tips.context: When suppressing lip sync - 'standing' prompt still had lip movement while 'standing silently' did not with node active

tips.tip: Remove any mention of speaking from prompt when using HuMo
tips.context: Let HuMo add it itself when it needs to, helps with long silences

tips.tip: Don't connect conditioning or model inputs to ChainSampler nodes unless changing them
tips.context: LATENT output line carries information from previous node

tips.tip: Set cond_retain_index_list to 0 for I2V with context windows
tips.context: Keeps the reference for I2V going through context windows

tips.tip: Use cache none for long workflows
tips.context: Otherwise they won't work without gigantic amounts of RAM

tips.tip: Try reducing prompt complexity for difficult subjects
tips.context: For subjects like Shrek with large mouth movements, change prompt to 'mumbling' instead of 'speaking' and reduce HN steps from 3 to 2

tips.tip: Drop a step on the 1st sampler to improve movement and lip movement
tips.context: Especially effective for non-realistic images

tips.tip: Change ETA levels to affect movement
tips.context: Can help control motion dynamics

tips.tip: Prompt better and prompt for motion to improve dynamics
tips.context: Try different seeds if specific segment doesn't have good lip sync

tips.tip: Use original image looking directly into lens
tips.context: Important for preventing odd eye movements during generation

tips.tip: Add audio delay at output for better sync
tips.context: Default 0.2s delay can be adjusted as necessary

tips.tip: Save video and reload to continue extensions
tips.context: When making very long videos beyond hardware limits

tips.tip: Use at least 5 frame overlap for smooth transitions
tips.context: Otherwise Vace doesn't know how to handle video pacing

tips.tip: Use show anything node to debug math node values
tips.context: When troubleshooting math node connections and values

tips.tip: Check each segment for lip sync quality before proceeding
tips.context: HuMo's lip sync performance is very seed-dependent, requires iteration on prompt and seed

tips.tip: Use empty audio and concat audio nodes for audio padding
tips.context: When needing to add silence at start of audio clips

tips.tip: Switch ComfyUI node packages to nightly to avoid version issues
tips.context: Manager silently downgrades packages causing node compatibility issues

tips.tip: Post-process extensions to smooth transitions
tips.context: A little VFX work helps smooth out extension artifacts between segments

tips.tip: Use different LoRA types for different model sections
tips.context: Use High Noise Wan 2.2 Lora for HN sections, Wan2.1 lora for LN section (HuMo)

tips.tip: Calculate video segments using division
tips.context: If each segment is 3.8 seconds, divide total audio duration by 3.8 to get number of segments needed

tips.tip: Trim final segment silence using frame manipulation
tips.context: Use 'Frames Slice' node and set stop frame as audio duration / frame rate to remove silence

tips.tip: Move Set Output_Video node to control workflow end point
tips.context: Move node to where you want video to end and mute remaining groups

concepts.explanation: Allows for unlimited number of frames, just takes longer to process
Inputs that prevent continuation frames from changing too much in VACE workflows
Tendency for characters and settings to change over chained generations
Continuation frames leave attention patterns that are hard to overcome with prompt changes
A caching mechanism that can be cranked up to speed up generation, used with low resolution base generation
Method to separate sampling into stages - first sampler without reference frame to get motion going, second sampler with VACE conditioning for control
New way to do negative prompting since CFG is zero and normal negative prompting doesn't work
Artifacts that appear when extending videos across multiple generation batches
Memory optimization technique where parts of model are loaded/unloaded from VRAM as needed to manage memory usage
Using different settings (like VACE strength) for different steps within the same generation
Tells ComfyUI to pretend you have less VRAM than you actually do, giving header room for VRAM usage spikes
Operating system feature where hard drive space supplements RAM dynamically - it's normal for disk space to change
Takes twice as long because it takes 2 substeps per full step, res_3s takes 3 substeps etc
Morphing technique that avoids usual Phantom problems at less than 121 frames
AI models break distant faces during camera zoom, unlike digital cameras, common in narrative films
Segmentation system used for detailing specific parts of images/video
Splits video into segments for detailed processing without OOM, each segment sampled at crop region dimensions
Shows first frame of each segment to indicate how many full videos will be sampled and stitched
New way VACE connects to detailer via hook instead of intrusive wrapper, makes nodes function more normally
Latent carries conditionings, model, sigmas, current step, raw latent - don't need other inputs unless changing them
*m samplers = 1 call per step, *s samplers = number before 's' calls per step (e.g. res_2s = 2x slower)
Controls how much noise is added and removed per step, similar to 'ancestral' or 'sde' in base ComfyUI. Higher eta allows more change per step, makes generation more flexible
Used to maintain character consistency throughout video generation by providing reference frames that prevent character degradation
Single frame references for style/appearance control, multiple references pile on top of each other, better to combine into single reference image
Sigma nodes take priority over sampler step settings when connected
Strength values are applied per latent frame, with first frame using reference strength and subsequent frames using control strengths
Occurs when nodes wait on each other creating circular dependency that breaks workflow execution
Phantom works by adding latent frames to existing frames and uses prompts internally for strength, while Vace reference is a separate control mechanism
Timing issue where components execute out of order, causing dependencies to not be available when needed
Occurs when workflow errors during encode/sample phase, then user fixes workflow and continues - model stays referenced somewhere
Using different images as phantom reference vs first frame produces better character consistency than using same image
Tile size should not evenly divide latent resolution to create overlap at edges and prevent seams
Video extension process that has intrinsic character degradation issues, more apparent on darker videos
At low denoise during upscaling, context switching is barely noticeable, allowing longer videos on limited VRAM
Wrapping ComfyUI workflow in FastAPI container for automated processing via cURL commands
Node that allows disabling specific video groups/segments in the workflow
Tracks which video segment is being processed, should increment for each run
16 optional prompt fields that can be filled for specific segments, get populated by LLM or manually
Gradual timing offset between audio and video that accumulates across segments
Using different model configurations for each upscaling pass
Production technique to sync all audio/video sources on multi-cam sets, prevents drift between sources
Settings that can cause specific issues with Wan processing
When multiple options provided for categories (Outfit, Environment, etc.), system cycles through items in order without repetition until all used, then restarts cycle
Visual artifact in WAN where small details like hair, textures drift or morph between frames, creating flickering effect. More noticeable than in closed source models.
Timing mismatch where audio gradually becomes out of sync with video over duration, typically audio being ~1 second longer than video
HuMo requires specific frame counts following mathematical pattern where n is integer
Provides context to LLM for prompt generation but doesn't affect actual audio sync
Alternative to lyrics for providing scene context, can be used for LoRA keywords
Strict Cycle uses each item once then repeats, Reference Guide uses everything as guide, Random Selection grabs randomly, Free Interpretation allows LLM to ignore/combine
Context string can be used alone or combined with lyrics, requires 'enable lyrics' to be on for context to work
Cuts off latent frames from end of video generation (2 latent = 8 real frames) because end frames can get weird as model converges to target
Lyric string has text limit to prevent issues with people screaming like 'ahhhhhhhhh' being too long for LLM context
High Noise model runs first pass at lower resolution, Low Noise model does second pass at higher resolution
Earlier blocks focus more on motion, used for training transition LoRAs
Upscaling in latent space between HN and LN passes to save VRAM and time, but can cause ghosting
Allows generation past 81 frames but with very long generation times
Memory management technique that happens automatically in native ComfyUI without additional nodes
When VACE continues motion past target frames then rotates back to align - occurs when start and end frames are identical
Simplified model that cuts out high noise model for speed but sits between Wan 2.1 and full 2.2 in quality
Specific video interpolation loras that need precise input preparation and often aren't compatible with each other
Issue where video colors gradually shift away from source when using frame-by-frame color matching instead of consistent video-wide matching
Method for integrating audio input into video generation by modifying attention mechanisms, more effective than band editing for HuMo
Artifact where first frames get overexposed or corrupted, happens when exceeding certain frame limits in generation
Runs first sampler for specified steps, then continues from that point with second sampler for remaining steps
Video generations need overlap to blend smoothly, but audio should be padded with silence instead of repeated
Combining SVI 2 Pro lora with SVI v2 lora for 2.1, using latter with HuMo instead of base Wan2.1
Segments that continue video generation from previous segments using specific timing and audio synchronization
High Noise and Low Noise sampling phases that can use different models - VACE for HN, HuMo for LN
Technique of adjusting seeds to achieve specific performance results, especially important for lip sync quality
Method to refine output with different model by reversing then resampling, slowest but potentially most accurate method

Uses Context Window system with pipe (|) separator to assign different prompts to different context windows (segments) rather than specific frame numbers. Windows are typically 81 frames with 16-frame overlap
High noise starts strong and fades to 0.0, low noise starts at 0.0 and finishes strong, with mid strength set to 0.5 and combined with opposing weights

limitations.limitation: Progressive quality degradation
limitations.details: Multiple generations cause gradual color shift and quality loss like copying VHS tapes

limitations.limitation: Scene consistency test challenges
limitations.details: Static scenes like windmills are torture tests that reveal coherence and color issues more easily

limitations.limitation: Motion reduction in subsequent passes
limitations.details: Each continuation pass tends to reduce overall motion in the generated video

limitations.limitation: LLM complex prompt handling
limitations.details: MMAudio doesn't handle complex prompts well, just does 'stuff' instead of following detailed instructions

limitations.limitation: TensorRT compatibility
limitations.details: TensorRT nodes not working on RTX 5090 yet, despite excellent performance on older cards

limitations.limitation: VACE iterates on itself without masking
limitations.details: When not using masking, VACE adds more detail at each sampler making transitions obvious

limitations.limitation: Prompt changes have limited effect in continuation
limitations.details: Residual self-attention makes dramatic prompt changes only slightly vary the result

limitations.limitation: LightX affects prompt adherence
limitations.details: Reduces realism and can cause unwanted camera artifacts when 'camera' mentioned

limitations.limitation: MultiTalk has no optimizations
limitations.details: Pretty big memory usage, needed 65 frame chunks

limitations.limitation: ComfyUI poor at looping
limitations.details: Visual coding tools always struggle with loop implementations

limitations.limitation: LoRAs tend to distort outputs more with each successive 5 second clip
limitations.details: Original problem trying to solve with depth control as sanity check

limitations.limitation: Lotus has quite the flicker factor
limitations.details: Unless doing something wrong, Lotus produces flickering

limitations.limitation: VACE wasn't trained to take normals as input
limitations.details: Can trick it into using them as depth but needs processing

limitations.limitation: Control video sometimes gets ignored with certain strength settings
limitations.details: At VACE encode strength 0.5, control video may be ignored

limitations.limitation: Prompt adherence issues in long generations
limitations.details: Video gets stuck at first prompt, doesn't change like prompts specify character changes

limitations.limitation: Pusa kills motion when combined with LightXv2
limitations.details: Requires additional LoRAs like reward, motion boost, movie gen to restore motion

limitations.limitation: Phantom limited to 4 reference images
limitations.details: Can work around by using collages of multiple characters per image slot

limitations.limitation: GGUF models incompatible with VACE module in native
limitations.details: Need to use merged models or wrapper workflows instead

limitations.limitation: WAN better for realistic content than creative/stylized
limitations.details: Struggles with creative or highly stylized prompts compared to realistic content

limitations.limitation: Pusa mostly trained on live action
limitations.details: Probably won't help much with 2D or stylized content

limitations.limitation: VACE and Phantom cannot work with i2v models
limitations.details: Not possible to make them work together with i2v models

limitations.limitation: Color changes from video to video in extensions
limitations.details: Everyone still having issues with colors changing from video to video when extending

limitations.limitation: Wan 2.2 still limited to 5s videos
limitations.details: Only 81 frames at 16fps work smoothly, going past requires Context Window Options which takes much longer

limitations.limitation: Control inputs can affect character likeness
limitations.details: Openpose, canny, depth can affect character likeness by forcing landmarks that may not match the character

limitations.limitation: VACE has issues with chaining samplers
limitations.details: Noticeable change in first frame when taking last frame of one sampler as first frame of next, unlike Wan2.2 i2v which handles this flawlessly

limitations.limitation: Fun Control model doesn't work well for continuation
limitations.details: Creates bright flashes to hide scene changes, model resists this usage

limitations.limitation: FaceDetailer doesn't work with videos
limitations.details: Only works with images, not compatible with Phantom or VACE models currently

limitations.limitation: Impact Pack treats video frames as separate images
limitations.details: Detailer for Video nodes encode each frame separately like AnimateDiff instead of treating as 5D tensor

limitations.limitation: LoRAs need retraining for Phantom base
limitations.details: Need to retrain with Phantom as base model for best effect

limitations.limitation: VACE integration with detailer is fragile
limitations.details: Very fragile, doesn't work well yet, lots of size errors

limitations.limitation: VACE causes over-contrast issues
limitations.details: Tends to create contrast problems in output

limitations.limitation: Open pose control is weak on VACE model
limitations.details: Needs extra strength, not surprising given the model architecture

limitations.limitation: Some samplers don't handle end frame transitions well
limitations.details: They sort of fade into the next frame instead of clean transitions

limitations.limitation: Context windows don't work with HuMo
limitations.details: Only drawback compared to Infinite talk

limitations.limitation: Color drift with VACE extensions is intrinsic
limitations.details: Will happen and depends heavily on the specific video being processed

limitations.limitation: Phantom resemblance depends on source similarity
